description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Added a new Get back online action in the worker menu so recovery is clearer for non-technical users.
- Worker recovery now reuses existing OpenWork access tokens instead of rotating them on restart.
Fixes & polish
- Improved sandbox worker reconnection flow after restart/recovery.
- Kept workspace session list wiring aligned with the new recovery action.
Packaging / ops
- Updated Docker dev stack mount behavior for host OpenCode config.
- Included standard package/version bump updates for v0.11.127.
Compare:
https://github.com/different-ai/openwork/compare/v0.11.126...v0.11.127
